page.title: 17Ugley Green
page.content: 1876. At that time it cost Â£100 to buy, and a mortgage had to be raised to buy it. Olive and Arthur's grandparents helped to bring up 13 children in the cottage. Their grandfather was a carpenter on the Ugley Hall estate. Ugley Hall itself is about 2km to the north of Ugley Green, in the village of Ugley. Once a year at the Hall the gleaning bell was rung at 5 o'clock in the morning before the annual harversting started. 'Gleaners' would then have one hour to gather for themselves as much of the crop as they could. Olive and Arthur's grandmother regularly used to go gleaning and managed to collect enough corn to keep the family in bread throughout the winter.
